pricing.title: Translation Approach - Cost & Trade-offs

i18n.name: Manual i18n (JSON catalogs)
i18n.pros: Full control; consistent wording; great for UI
i18n.cons: Manual updates; not ideal for user/vendor content

cloud.name: Cloud Translation API
cloud.pros: Auto-translate dynamic content; scalable; fast to ship
cloud.cons: Recurring cost; glossary setup; quality varies

hybrid.name: Hybrid (i18n + API)
hybrid.cost: Mixed: Free for UI, pay-per-use for content

pricing.refs: References: Google Translate Pricing · Azure Translator Pricing · AWS Translate Pricing

i18n.title: What is i18n (internationalization)?
i18n.body1: i18n means engineering the app so it can switch languages without code changes. UI text lives in translation catalogs, not hardcoded strings.

points.structured: Structured UI wording in JSON catalogs (e.g., en.json, ne.json)
points.plurals: Correct plural, number, date, and currency formatting
points.seo: Better accessibility and SEO via lang attributes and localized routes

cloud.title: What are Cloud Translation APIs?
cloud.body1: Hosted services (Google, Microsoft, AWS) that translate text you send them - ideal for vendor-generated or large dynamic content.

points.dynamic: Great for dynamic text: products, blogs, reviews
points.glossary: Glossaries keep brand and domain terms consistent
points.cache: Cache translations to control latency and cost

hybrid.title: What is the Hybrid approach?
hybrid.body1: Use i18n for platform UI (full control) and Cloud APIs for dynamic content (scale). This balances quality and speed.

points.split: Split responsibilities: static UI via i18n, dynamic content via API
points.quality: Control key terms in UI; let APIs handle volume content
points.scale: Scales to more languages with minimal engineering changes
